abstracts.cdata!:
This Implementation Completion Report
            (ICR) covers the National Polytechnic Institute Project in
            Lao People's Democratic Republic. Specific objectives
            included: (a) increasing capacity to supply engineers; (b)
            improving the planning, management and quality of existing
            engineering training programs; (c) promoting the integration
            and coordination of higher technician training programs; and
            (d) initiating analysis of issues in the education sector.
            Bank's performance was not satisfactory.
            Borrower's performance was satisfactory. The key
            lessons learned were as follows: (i) it is difficult to
            address public university salary deficiencies outside the
            broader context of public and private sector remuneration
            issues; (ii) initial agreement by all parties on a set of
            common standards, assumptions and objectives is essentialt o
            smoothi mplementation; (iii) short-term academic training
            requires careful attention to language issues and the
            identification of appropriate technical assistance
            providers; and (iv) frequent change of task management
            defeats the purpose of supervision.
